subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Perennial Philosophy: All Paths Lead to One
description: Learn The Perennial Philosophy: All Paths Lead to One in one minute.

hook.text: Strip away the rituals, the rules, the labels. Every religion points to the same truth. At least, that's the bold claim.

buildup.text: Aldous Huxley called it the 'perennial philosophy': a core truth shared by all mystical traditions across history.

discovery.text: Mystics from every tradition report unity, love, and ego dissolution. Experiences converge even as theologies diverge.

twist.text: Critics say this erases real differences. Hinduism and Islam don't say the same thing. Flattening them is disrespectful.

climax.text: Maybe all paths don't lead to one. Maybe the question matters more than the answer. Seeking itself might be the point.

punchline.text: Do all religions say the same thing? Maybe the search matters more than answers.

quiz.question: What is the perennial philosophy?
options: The idea that all religions share a common core truth beneath surface differences
